title: iOS: no touch.exit event fired
body:
When overriding the OnTouch function in iOS, and the touch moves outside the view, there is never any touch event fired. Thus, it's impossible to tell if the finger has been released or not.

This is a Xamarin.Forms project and I do not see this problem in Android or UWP.

My view is inside a Master-Detail page, so it's possible that the Master-Detail hijacked the touch event, but then we should get a touch-cancelled event. I'll see if I have time to create a reproduction later this week, but it's pretty simple to create.
